title: Safe Shipping Timing in Summer and Winter
metaTitle: When to Ship Wine: Safe Temperatures for Summer/Winter | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Heat and freezing cold can ruin wine in transit. Learn the safe shipping windows and how to protect your collection during transport.
summary: How temperature and delays affect bottles and how to reduce risk during transit.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Wine is perishable. Shipping standard Ground during July or January is a recipe for disaster. We monitor weather daily.
list: Safe Range: 40째F to 75째F along the ENTIRE route.
Summer Strategy: Use Next Day Air (AM delivery) or Temperature Controlled Freight.
Winter Strategy: Avoid freezing (corks push out). Wait for a warm spell.
Hold for Weather: We often pay you now and ship later when safe.

sections.heading: The Danger Zone
list: A UPS/FedEx truck can reach 120째F in summer. 2 hours in that heat will cook your wine.
Freezing temps can freeze the wine, cracking the bottle or pushing the cork.

sections.heading: Shipping Strategies
list: Monday Shipping: Always ship early in the week so wine doesn't sit in a warehouse over the weekend.
Styrofoam Shippers: Essential insulation. Cardboard dividers offer zero thermal protection.
Ice Packs: Helpful for short trips (Overnight), but useless for 5-day Ground (they melt and create condensation).

sections.heading: Using Temperature Control
content: For large collections (pallets), we use refrigerated trucks (Reefer trucks).
list: Takes longer (2-3 weeks cross country) but is 100% safe.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Demanding 'Ship Now' in August during a heatwave.
Assuming 'Overnight' is safe (it sits on a tarmac for hours).

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Check the 10-day forecast for Origin and Destination.
Ask us about our 'Hold for Weather' option (free storage).
Order proper Styrofoam shippers from us if you need them.

faqs.question: Do spirits need temp control?
faqs.answer: Generally no. Whiskey and Tequila are high alcohol and very stable. They can ship Ground safely in most weather.

faqs.question: Can I use dry ice?
faqs.answer: No! Dry ice is dangerous goods and can freeze the wine instantly. Never use it.

faqs.question: Who pays for shipping?
faqs.answer: We typically cover shipping costs. We will select the method based on value and weather.

faqs.question: What about insurance?
faqs.answer: We insure all shipments. However, insurance often denies 'heat damage' claims if shipped against advice. Safety first.

faqs.question: Is early morning delivery better?
faqs.answer: Yes. Delivery by 10:30 AM avoids the hottest part of the day in the delivery truck.
